intro: Connarus perrottetii var. perrottetii, commonly known as the African ebony, is a tropical tree native to Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland areas with well-drained soil. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and elliptical in shape, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
